violation: Speeding in thickly settled or business district
law_text: No person shall operate a motor vehicle at a speed exceeding 30 miles per hour in a thickly settled or business district, except as otherwise provided by local ordinance.
preventive_tip: Observe posted limits and slow down in dense residential or business areas.
rule_summary: In thickly settled or business districts, the default maximum speed is 30 mph unless a local ordinance sets a different limit.

law_text: No operator of a motor vehicle shall use a mobile electronic device while operating such vehicle, including while temporarily stationary due to traffic, a traffic control device, or other momentary delays.
penalty: First offense: $100, Second offense: $250, Third offense: $500 + insurance surcharge
preventive_tip: Use hands-free or pull over safely before using your phone.
rule_summary: Handheld mobile device use is prohibited while driving, including when temporarily stopped in traffic or at signals.

law_text: Whoever operates a motor vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating liquor, or of marijuana, narcotic drugs, depressants or stimulant substances shall be punished.
penalty: First offense: Up to 2.5 years jail, $500-$5000 fine, 1-year license suspension
preventive_tip: Never drive after alcohol or drug use; use a designated driver or rideshare.
rule_summary: Operating a vehicle under the influence of alcohol or drugs is a serious offense with criminal penalties and license consequences.

law_text: The driver of any vehicle shall obey the instructions of any official traffic control signal applicable thereto placed in accordance with law, unless otherwise directed by a police officer.
preventive_tip: Stop fully at red lights and proceed only when safe and permitted.
rule_summary: Drivers must obey official traffic signals unless a police officer directs otherwise.

violation: Parking in handicapped space without permit
law_text: No person shall park in a space designated for handicapped persons unless displaying a valid handicapped parking placard or license plate.
preventive_tip: Use accessible spaces only with a valid placard or plate.
rule_summary: Only vehicles displaying a valid disabled placard or plate may park in designated accessible spaces.

law_text: No person shall operate a motor vehicle on any way unless such person has a license or permit to operate such vehicle issued by the registrar.
preventive_tip: Keep your license valid and carry it while driving.
rule_summary: A valid license or permit issued by the registrar is required to operate a motor vehicle on public ways.

law_text: No person shall drive a vehicle upon a highway at a speed greater than is reasonable or prudent having due regard for weather, visibility, traffic, and surface conditions.
preventive_tip: Adjust speed for weather, traffic, and road conditions.
rule_summary: Drivers must travel at a reasonable and prudent speed based on real-time conditions such as weather, visibility, traffic, and road surface.

penalty_structure.fine_note: May increase based on circumstances and local assessments

law_text: A person shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway unless that person and all passengers 16 years of age or over are properly restrained by a safety belt.
preventive_tip: Buckle up before you start driving.
rule_summary: Drivers must ensure they and passengers aged 16+ are properly restrained by a safety belt while operating a vehicle on a highway.

law_text: Drivers may not hold and operate a handheld wireless telephone or electronic communications device while driving.
penalty: Base fine varies; increased penalties for repeat offenses
preventive_tip: Use hands-free and set navigation before moving.
rule_summary: Drivers are prohibited from holding and operating handheld phones or electronic communication devices while driving.

penalty_structure.fine_note: Base fine varies; higher penalties for repeat offenses

violation: Failure to yield to pedestrian in crosswalk
law_text: Every driver of a vehicle shall yield the right of way to a pedestrian crossing the roadway within any marked crosswalk or within any unmarked crosswalk at an intersection.
preventive_tip: Stop for pedestrians and scan intersections proactively.

law_text: Drivers may not use portable electronic devices to compose, send, read, access, browse, transmit, save or retrieve email, text messages, or other electronic data while driving.
penalty: Fines and points; increased for repeat violations
preventive_tip: Enable driving focus mode and avoid handling devices.

law_text: A person may not operate a vehicle in a school crossing zone at a speed of more than 15 miles per hour during the times designated by the sign.
penalty: $200-$400 fine, may be higher in school zones
preventive_tip: Watch for school-zone signage and flashing lights.

law_text: A person commits an offense if the person is at least 15 years of age and rides in a passenger vehicle without securing the safety belt.
preventive_tip: Ensure all occupants are buckled before moving.
